feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition
feed.subtitle: SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SSO Configuration Issue When Accessing S/4HANA Public Cloud content via SAP Build Work Zone
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to display a S/4HANA public cloud application in SAP Build Work Zone. I followed the tutorial below and was able to successfully display the app:

üîó https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-build-work-zone-integrate-sap-s-4hana-public-cloud-content-to-sap/ba-p/13572886

 

However, I encountered an issue:
If I am already logged into the Public Cloud or Cloud Identity Services, clicking the tile opens the app correctly.
But if I am not logged in, clicking the tile shows the following error message:
‚ÄúThis domain is not authenticated. Please contact your system administrator.‚Äù

 

I would like to achieve SSO (Single Sign-On) so that logging into Build Work Zone alone allows access to the Public Cloud app.
Is this not possible?
If it is possible, how can I configure it?

In the tutorial, I set the destination for N5T_Starter_rt_apps to No Authentication ‚Äî could this be causing the issue?

entry.title: Work Zone: text widgets in a single row, height no longer aligns
entry.content:
Work Zone has once again unilaterally changed the way it behaves with the result of messing up my design.

Until this morning (13 Aug 25) when adding text widgets to a single row (a freestyle section with multiple columns), text widgets were presented as the same height, regardless of how much text was in each.

See example, below: each of the three elements has a different amount of text (2 lines, 3 lines, 1 line), but the white boxes all displayed with the same height as the largest box.

Perfect - a nice balanced design.

Now here's what it looks like:

The text widget height is controlled by the amount of text in each widget. My design looks like a row of wonky teeth. Thanks SAP.

So what has happened and why? When are we going to get consulted or at the very least notified in advance of these sorts of changes? See my other posts for other rants about SAP changing the front end unilaterally. 

Honestly SAP, you are consistently disappointing. If you expect us to promote your product in any way you need to get better at this.

entry.title: Fallback method for opening web applications in iframe if loading fails
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am trying to implement a fallback mechanism for opening a web application inside an iframe. If the app fails to load in the iframe, I want to automatically open it in a new browser tab.

Here‚Äôs are the implementations that I have tried so far, I am providing a brute code of the methods that I have tried implementing:

onTilePress: function (oEvent) {
    var sUrl = oEvent.getSource().getBindingContext("appModel").getProperty("url");
    var oFrame = this.byId("appFrame");

    // attachAfterRendering for iframe handling
    oFrame.attachAfterRendering({ url: sUrl }, function (oEvent, oData) {
        var iframe = document.querySelector("iframe");

        if (!iframe) {
            console.error("Iframe not found");
            return;
        }

        // Listen for load success/failure
        iframe.onload = function () {
            console.log("App loaded successfully in iframe");
        };

        iframe.onerror = function () {
            console.error("Error loading app in iframe, opening in new tab");
            window.open(oData.url, "_blank");
        };

        // Safety fallback - message event listener
        window.addEventListener("message", function (e) {
            console.log("Message received from origin:", e.origin);
            // Expected origin is from embedded app, but I only get the portal origin here
        });

        // Detach afterrendering after execution
        oFrame.detachAfterRendering();
    });
}

 

Challenges I am facing:

  1. iframe.onload and iframe.onerror are never triggered ‚Äì not even for successful apps.

  2. onAfterRendering only detects the UI5 HTML control render, not the internal iframe load state.

  3. When listening for postMessage, I get the custom portal origin (e.g., https://port8081-workspaces...) instead of the embedded app‚Äôs origin, so I cannot distinguish failures correctly.


    Can someone please help me to find a correct way to detect if an app inside an iframe has failed to load in SAP UI5 (so that I can implement a proper fallback to open it in a new tab)?
    Also suggest if is there a recommended UI5 mechanism to achieve this?

    Thanks in advance,
    Sai Krishna.

entry.title: Build Process automation approval form request isn‚Äôt showing up in the Workzone My Inbox
entry.content:
In SAP Build Process Automation (Standard subscription), the approval form requests aren‚Äôt showing up in the Workzone My Inbox for new business users. However, it‚Äôs working fine for the three older business users. I‚Äôve checked, and both new and old users have the same roles assigned, so I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs causing the difference.

Do we need to map CIS business users somewhere in the tenant configuration or make any additional setup for new users?

Would really appreciate your insights on this issue to resolve it.

#SAPBuildProcessAutomation
#WorkzoneInbox
#ApprovalFormIssue
#BusinessUserMapping
#TenantConfiguration
#CISUserSetup
#WorkflowTroubleshooting
#SAPSupport
#AutomationIssue
#UserAccessIssue

entry.title: Deployed CAP+Fiori App is running, but UI gives 404 on metadata call and is not visible in Work Zone
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I'm developing a full-stack application in SAP Business Application Studio and I'm facing a final issue after a seemingly successful deployment to Cloud Foundry.

My Project Setup:

  • Backend: SAP CAP with Node.js

  • Database: SAP HANA Cloud, using synonyms to access tables from another container.

  • Frontend: SAP Fiori Elements (List Report Object Page template).

  • Security: Using a standard XSUAA service.

  • Deployment Target: The final goal is to integrate the app into our SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition.

The Problem / Observed Behavior: The deployment to Cloud Foundry using cf deploy completes 100% successfully. In the CF space, I can see that my applications (-srv, -ui) are in the "Started" state, and the -db-deployer is "Stopped", which is the expected behavior.

The issue is that the application is unreachable and invisible to end-users:

  1. When I access the direct URL of the CAP backend service (...-srv.cfapps...), I correctly see the CAP welcome page listing my service endpoint at /odata/v4/catalog. This confirms the backend is alive and serving the correct path.

  2. However, when I access the main UI application URL (...-ui.cfapps...), the page title loads, but the rest of the page is blank.

  3. Checking the browser's developer console, I see a 404 (Not Found) error when the application tries to fetch the service metadata. The failing request is: GET .../odata/v4/catalog/$metadata.

  4. Consequently, the application does not appear in the Content Explorer of the SAP Build Work Zone after refreshing the "HTML5 Apps" content provider.

My Question: What could be the reason for the 404 Not Found error during the metadata call from the UI, given that the deployment is successful and the backend service is confirmed to be running and serving the correct path? It seems there is a routing or communication issue between the AppRouter (-ui app) and the CAP service (-srv app) that I am unable to diagnose further.

Relevant Configuration Files attached

entry.title: How to authorize a CF-deployed HTML5 app via a Content Package role in SAP Build Work Zone (Standard
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I‚Äôm a junior SAP developer working with SAP Build Work Zone, standard edition, and I‚Äôm running into difficulties with content packages.

Here‚Äôs my current setup:

  • I deployed a custom UI5 application via Cloud Foundry from BAS (cf deploy application.mtar).

  • I‚Äôm managing roles, tiles, spaces, and pages through a Content Package.

What works so far:

  • I can deploy custom tiles from the content package.

  • I can configure intent-based navigation (inbounds) to launch my app.

Where I‚Äôm stuck:

  • I cannot get authorization to work for the HTML5 app via a custom role.

  • I don‚Äôt know the correct way to reference the CF-deployed HTML5 app so that it can be added to the list of authorized apps in my content package role.

  • Currently, it only works if I assign the app to the Everyone role, which of course is not secure.

My current package looks like this:
content-package/

‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ card/
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ all the files necessary for a custom card (working fine)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ cdm/
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ apptodeploy.json
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ page.json
‚îÇ ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ role.json
‚îÇ ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ space.json
‚îÇ
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ content.json
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ manifest.json

I've referenced the app I'm trying to access to using its SAPUI5 Component Name (same as its id), as it appears in the content manager. I've exported the app from the CM and noted that its full name in the exported file is saas_approuter_appID, so I've tried that too, to no avail. And I've tried to create a businessapp in /cdm/apptodeploy.json in order to create a sort of placeholder for the app so that I can reference it, but to no avail either.

Question(s):
Is there a best practice for exposing CF-deployed HTML5 apps in a Content Package (CDM), so they can be authorized via custom roles? Has anyone implemented this workflow successfully? Any examples, documentation, or working patterns would be greatly appreciated.

Thanks in advance for your guidance!

entry.title: "Could Not Open App" Error in SAP Mobile Start Android App
entry.content:
Dear SAP Experts,

I have recently configured SAP Build Work Zone for SAP Mobile Start to access apps and content from SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.

For the setup, I referred to the following resources:

SAP Community Blog: SAP Build Work Zone ‚Äì Integrate SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud content to SAP Mobile Start

SAP Learning Journey: Setting Up SAP Build Work Zone (standard edition) and SAP Mobile Start with SAP S/4HANA

I used the OpenID Connect method to establish the trust configuration between my BTP Subaccount and Cloud Identity Service.

The issue is: When I access applications via the desktop through my Work Zone site, everything works perfectly without any issues.



However, when I try to open the same application on my Android device, I encounter the following error:




Could you please provide detailed steps or possible resolutions to troubleshoot and fix this issue ?

entry.title: Performance difference between SAP BTP Free Account and Paid Account?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I‚Äôm currently working with an SAP BTP Free Account and I‚Äôve noticed some performance limitations when running applications and services (for example, SAP Build Apps, CAP services, and OData calls).

Before moving to a paid account, I‚Äôd like to understand:

  • Are there any performance differences (speed, responsiveness, system resources) between Free and Paid accounts?

  • Do paid accounts get more consistent service levels (e.g., CPU/memory allocation, faster response times, higher quotas)?

  • Is there any official documentation or benchmarks comparing Free vs. Paid accounts?

I‚Äôd really appreciate insights from anyone who has tested both environments or moved from Free to Paid.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: Work Zone Integration Card induces Tile centering
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

I am facing a small issue when adding integration cards in the workzone.

Our workzone has multiple tabs, one of them with (ui integration) cards. When directly opening a tab without a card the content, one app represented by a tile, looks as follows:
__________________________________
no shift

__________________________________

On the other hand, when one previously opened a tab with a card, the content seems to be centered on all other tabs. The screenshot is a bit misleading - the content is actually centered vertically and not bottom-bound as this image might indicate.
__________________________________

__________________________________

Has anyone observed this shift of orientation of app tiles from top bound to centered when previously accessing a ui integration card containing work zone tab?

Greetings

entry.title: how do I send a request to the SPA workflow from Custom fiori app?
entry.content:
Hi all,
 I'm having an issue with the SAP build process automation.  I created a simple workflow structure and deployed. After, I tested whether  the workflow service on the api.sap site and Postman.   The workflow is working and successfully ƒ± see task in myinbox. 
But when ƒ± try to request from my  custom fiori it gives error.  When I adapt the request in the post, I get a cors error.  So  I thought I definitely needed to send a request through the destination, so I created a destination from the service instance. 
my destination :


After  I described this destinationin xs.app.json file like that

      {
      "source": "^/spalast/(.*)$",
      "target": "/public/workflow/rest/v1/$1",
      "destination": "spa",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "csrfProtection": false
    },
and lastly my test requests: 

             fetch("/spalast/workflow-instances", {
                method: "POST",
                headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
                body: JSON.stringify({
                    definitionId: "eu10.integration-suite-dev-25mloa6z.employeeapitriggerprocess.employeeProcess",
                    context: { employee: { /* ... */ } }
                })
            });
              fetch("/spalast/workflow-instances", {
                method: "GET",
                headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" }
            });

ƒ±t  gives 403 error  from the POST request and 404 error from the GET request.

What could be the reason for this?  Most of the blogs I read also redirect in this way.

entry.title: How to approve/reject tasks directly in SAP Mobile Start app (s/4hana cloud public edition)
entry.content:
Hello,

We have integrated SAP S/4HANA Cloud with SAP Mobile Start through SAP Build Work Zone.
The purchaser and purchasing manager roles have been exposed to BTP and assigned in Build Work Zone.

After completing all notification-related configurations, we are able to receive purchase requisition approval tasks both on the mobile device and on the Build Work Zone home page.

However, to actually approve or reject a task, we still need to navigate to the tenant and process it there.

Is there a way to handle these approval/rejection actions directly from the SAP Mobile Start app without navigating to the tenant?

Thanks in advance for your guidance.

entry.title: What is the best way to deploy a custom UI card in the BWZ?
entry.content:
Hello, 

I am currently deploying an MTA from the BAS to the BWZ, and using a cdm.json file to manage group, apps and roles. And I cannot figure out whether it is possible to implement custom UI Card instead of the basic tiles this way, or if it is mandatory that I use a content-package to deploy those.

If it is possible, are there any resources on this topic? I haven't found anything in the documentation or among the various tutorials. 

If it isn't, what is considered the best practice to deploy UI cards?

Thanks for your guidance, 

Th√©odore

entry.title: User Provisioning Issue in SAP Build Work Zone, Standard Edition
entry.content:
Hi Team,

 

I have did the setp up for BWZ, SE and doing the User provising from AD by creating the Source and Target system in the SAP Cloud Identity Service.

 

After running the sync job, getting the below error:

Cannot execute provisioning job in tenant context: <tenant id>
Caused by: Error during execution on behalf of tenant with ID: <tenant id>
Caused by: Can not read entities from source system: 'SAPBuildWorkZoneStandard_Source_QA: 46d3bce5-72c3-4d16-9612-1025d1f39a15'
Caused by: HTTP operation failed invoking https://<tenant id>.accounts.ondemand.com/scim/Users?startId=initial&count=100 with statusCode: 401 and body {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"401","detail":"Authentication credentials are invalid or not allowed for this endpoint."}
Caused by: HTTP operation failed invoking https://<tenant id>.accounts.ondemand.com/scim/Users?startId=initial&count=100 with statusCode: 401, Response: {"schemas":["urn:ietf:params:scim:api:messages:2.0:Error"],"status":"401","detail":"Authentication credentials are invalid or not allowed for this endpoint."}

PFA the screen shot for your reference. I have give the user and password from the BWZ, SE Instance service key as per the sap documentation.

 

Please suggest what can be the issue.

Regards,

Rohit Gera

entry.title: SAP S4 HANA Public Cloud ODATA V4 API throwing 403 error blocked by UCON
entry.content:
We are facing an issue with one ODAT V4  UI type service in S4 HANA public cloud system. Use case is: We have Developed a custom ODATA V4 UI service and created a Fiori elements based UI app in BAS and deployed on BTP Workzone. We have tested this app in Dev system and everything working as expected. But when we transported the same custom service and UI app to Quality system, the ODATA V4 service is throwing 403 Forbidden UCON Blocked error when we try to load the App or load the metadata from browser as well. 

 

Anyone has worked on ODATA V4 UI  API and created a UI app using BTP BAS? Your inputs are highly appreciated. Thanks.

SAP Fiori for SAP S/4HANA

entry.title: Unable to deploy application with cdm.json ‚Äì 404 errors in Build Work Zone
entry.content:
Hello,

Our project involves deploying a Fiori/UI5 application and its associated library to the BTP subaccount DEV_TAL (region: Europe Netherlands ‚Äì eu20), where deployments through BAS and Cloud Foundry normally succeed without errors. We are encountering persistent issues when attempting to migrate deployment of our application through a cdm.json in SAP Build Work Zone.

When deploying from SAP Business Application Studio via Cloud Foundry (mbt build > cf deploy app.mtar), the process works as expected: the application appears in the HTML5 Applications repository, can be managed in the Content Manager, and finally runs correctly when exposed in a site.

The difficulties arise specifically when switching to a CDM-based deployment. Our goal is to automate group and role creation and ensure consistent provisioning of application tiles. For testing, we are deploying a minimal MTA consisting of one application and one library. After setting up the CDM and RT destinations, creating the content provider, and assigning the required roles to both user and site, the tile appears correctly in Build Work Zone.

However, once launched, the application fails to load properly: in the HTML5 Applications repository, the application runs without errors ‚Äì the database not being connected is normal at this point. In Build Work Zone, the tile opens but the application immediately crashes with a flurry of 404 errors. As a result, the application does not boot at all, and the intended library resources remain inaccessible.

We have followed the official tutorial Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Build Work Zone and reproduced its GitHub template, but the outcome remains the same. The issue appears to be tied to the CDM integration and how the application accesses its library and resources once deployed in Build Work Zone.

 

 

 

Environment

  • Subaccount: DEV_TAL
  • Subdomain: dev-tal-ks9oev3t
  • Subaccount ID: 8b106794-ec42-4ee1-bacf-a039900b13cb
  • Tenant ID: 8b106794-ec42-4ee1-bacf-a039900b13cb
  • Org Name (CF): ARGONandCO_dev-tal-ks9oev3t
  • Org ID (CF): cafe0aa6-6373-455c-9dd1-f52e2e435364
  • Region: Europe (Netherlands) ‚Äì eu20
  • API Endpoint: https://api.cf.eu20-001.hana.ondemand.com
  • Space: dev

 

Reproduction Steps

  1. Run mbt to generate .mtar.
  2. Deploy via cf deploy app.mtar.
  3. Application appears in HTML5 Applications repository in cockpit.
  4. Create a Content Provider using both cdm and rt destinations
  5. Add role to both User and website
  6. Tile appears in BWZ.
  7. Launch the tile.

 

Observed Behavior

  • Tile name appears correctly in BWZ.
  • In the HTML5 Applications repository: application launches with its library
  • In the BWZ: application crashes and shows numerous 404 errors appear in the console.
  • Application does not boot.

 

Expected Behavior

  • Application should launch without errors.
  • Library should be available, and components should load.
  • Groups and roles should be automatically created by CDM.

 

Tests Performed

  • Added and removed the cap-ui prefix to all destinations: no effect, 404 errors persist.
  • Changed _schema-version between "3.1" and "3.2" and the the library path from "/cap-ui.argonuilib-1.0.0" to "/cap-ui.argonuilib", as per the template: no effect, same errors observed.

 

Attachments

  • cdm.json
  • mta.yaml
  • screenshots from BWZ and HTML5 error logs
  • manifests of both application and library
  • index.html of the application

 

References

  • Tutorial followed: Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Bu... - SAP Community (GitHub template reproduced).

 

Request

  • Confirm whether additional tenant-specific configuration (e.g. contentProvider mapping) is required.
  • Clarify which files are critical in CDM deployment that could block the process (mta.yaml, cdm.json, manifest.json, xs-app.json, ui5.yaml‚Ä¶).
  • Clarify the pathing necessary to and from the library from the application (e.g. resourceRoots in manifest.json, data-sap-ui-resourceroots in index.html, etc.).
  • Clarify where and when the sap.cloud.service should be attached to destinations

entry.title: SAP Build Apps Redirects to Initial Page in Work Zone on Browser Refresh
entry.content:
SAP Build Apps Redirects to Initial Page in Work Zone on Browser Refresh

 

Hello Community,

I am experiencing an issue with state management and routing when running an SAP Build Apps application deployed within SAP Build Work Zone Standard Edition (Trial Account).

Configuration and Setup:

  1. I created and deployed an SAP Build Apps application on sap build Work zone.

  2. In the Work Zone, I updated the Channel Manager and added the HTML5 Application in the content mange and then added it to my catalog. 

The Problem:

The application launches correctly from the tile and operates as expected. However, the application appears to be running without proper URL routing synchronization with the Work Zone shell:

  • When I navigate to a secondary page within the Build App, the URL in the browser address bar remains unchanged.

  • Consequently, if I perform a browser refresh (F5) while on a secondary page, the application redirects back to the application's initial/Home Page.
